title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki

10:07 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:11 <cjdelisle> Look seriously, if you’re an advanced db admin wanting to learn a NOSQL system, choose HBase. It’s so damn complex that safe pairs of hands are going to get paid well.  
10:11 <cjdelisle> "     "  
10:32 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <pulasthi>  cjdelisle:: hi  
10:36 <pulasthi> hey i came acros db apache couchdb  
10:37 <pulasthi> it seemed kind of intersting just thought i should mention  
10:37 <pulasthi> :)  
10:37 <cjdelisle> yup. On my list to evaluate is mongodb which is a similar system.  
10:38 <pulasthi> ahh alright :)  
10:38 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <pulasthi> btw for the project if we are using DN is a convertion layer needed to convert from XWQL-DN  
10:39 <cjdelisle> Cassandra seems to have the most community momentum so unless mongo/couch are far superior, I think Cassandra will be better simply because it is more likely to become a standard.  
10:39 <pulasthi> ya but it will still go on DN right  
10:39 <cjdelisle> Yes, a wuery rewriter is I think what they had in mind.  
10:40 <cjdelisle> \*query rewriter  
10:40 <pulasthi> ok thanks  
10:40 <pulasthi> working on the proposal  
10:40 <pulasthi> :)  
10:41 <cjdelisle> Yea, DN seems to have no competition, I'll have to look around more. I was actually the one who discovered it and mentioned it off hand only to come back and find everyone talking about it.  
10:42 <pulasthi> :D  
10:42 <pulasthi> kk

14:56 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
15:04 <sbose78> has joined #xwiki  
15:04 <sbose78> Hello, I'm Shoubhik Bose  
15:05 <cjdelisle> howdy  
15:05 <sbose78> I wish to work on "XWiki on AppEngine prototype"  
15:06 <cjdelisle> Have you used App Engine?  
15:06 <sbose78> Yes,  
15:06 <sbose78> I'm an Appengine Developer  
15:06 <sbose78> (JAVA)  
15:06 <cjdelisle> What did you think of it?  
15:07 <sbose78> Honestly, I haven't worked on XWiki queries  
15:07 <sbose78> But, I have worked on many database systems.  
15:07 <sbose78> I think I can do the job.  
15:08 <cjdelisle> What did you think of App Engine?  
15:08 <sbose78> Being honest, the best part of Appengine is that one can concentrate on the code !  
15:08 <cjdelisle> And the worst part?  
15:09 <sbose78> Worst Part,.. significant changes in code need to be made if the application has to be ported to a different database  
15:10 <cjdelisle> That was what I was seeing from it.  
15:11 <sbose78> Yeah, And hence the proposal for the project !  
15:11 <cjdelisle> Did you send mail to the list as per the gsoc page instructions?  
15:12 <sbose78> you mean the mailing list , Right?  
15:12 <cjdelisle> yes  
15:13 <sbose78> I'm afraid I haven't ( As I was busy with a web development project IBM TGMC 2010) and didn't do well with the rules for GSOC  
15:13 <sbose78> Sincere apologies for this. What should I do now?  
15:14 <sbose78> I hope its not late .  
15:15 <cjdelisle> !search google summer of code  
15:16 <supreet> has joined #xwiki  
15:16 <cjdelisle> third one down looks right  
15:16 <cjdelisle> Have you used Cassandra?  
15:16 <sbose78> No, I haven't.  
15:18 <sbose78> Project proposal requires me to use Cassandra/Appengine  ,right?  
15:19 <sbose78> By the way, links the helpful. My student application form is ready though (almost).  
15:19 <cjdelisle> Does app engine provide local hard disk storage?  
15:20 <sbose78> No.  
15:20 <cjdelisle> ahh, then it is indeed either or. Cassandra needs disk space.  
15:21 <sbose78> I'm sorry. I didn't get you. Is local disk storage a requirement?  
15:22 <cjdelisle> Cassandra requires it.  
15:22 <cjdelisle> I'm off to get something to eat. bbiab  
15:23 <sbose78> Sure.  
15:23 <sbose78> Oh, I get it. Then we must go for Appengine.  
15:26 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
15:30 <mflorea1> has quit  
15:31 <+sburjan`> sbose78: it's not too late. You can send the e-mail on the dev list  
15:32 <sbose78> Okay.  
15:32 <sbose78> Thanks  
15:33 <+sburjan`> sbose78: afaik 8th April is the deadline  
15:33 <+sburjan`> http://www.google-melange.com/document/show/gsoc\_program/google/gsoc2011/timeline  
15:33 <+sburjan`> yes, 8th April  
15:34 <sbose78> sburjan:yeah , I'm aware of that. But , Its good to talk to the developers before making a formal Application.  
15:35 <+sburjan`> yes, it's a good idea to make devs aware of your intentions. It could help you a lot they have to decide who to pick  
15:36 <+sburjan`> but also don't forget about the formal form  
15:36 <sbose78> yeah, of course .  
15:38 <abusenius\_> is now known as <abusenius>  
15:46 <vmassol> has quit  
15:46 <sbose78> I'm going out, Will be back after sometime.
